repository.orgName: Staats- und Universitätsbibliothek Hamburg Carl von Ossietzky

msContents.summary: A manuscript containing the Nyāyasudhā, Jayatīrtha's commentary on the Anuvyākhyāna of Ānandatīrtha ad Bādarāyaṇa's Brahmasūtra (Adhyāya 1, from Brahmasūtra 1.1.3-1.1.29).

msItem.title: Nyāyasudhā
msItem.author: Jayatīrtha
msItem.rubric: śubham astu || śrīrāmacaṃdrāya namaḥ ||—|| hariḥ oṃ ||—||
msItem.incipit:
oṃ śāstrayonitvāt ||—|| jagajjanmādikāraṇatvaṃ parabrahmaṇo viṣṇor lakṣaṇam ityabhihitaṃ | tasya harahiraṇyagarbhādicetaneṣu pradhā
nādyacetaneṣu ca pāśupatādyāgamānumānāvaṣṭambhenātivyāptimāśaṅkyātra pariharati bhagavāntsūtrakāraḥ |
msItem.explicit:
evam asminn adhyāye parabrahmaṇanārāyaṇe pratipāditasya sakalaśrutisamanvayasya phalaṃ janmādisūtroditasya lakṣaṇasiddhi/
m upasaṃharati ||—|| pūrṇeti || pūrṇāḥ pratyekaṃ niravadhikāḥ ||—|| iti śrīmatpūrṇapramatibhagavatpādasukṛter anuvyākhyānasya praguṇajayatīrthākhyayatinā | kṛtāyāṃ ṭīkāyāṃ
viṣamapadavākyārthavivṛtāvayaṃ pūrvārdhyāye paramacaraṇaḥ paryavasitaḥ ||—||
msItem.finalRubric:
iti śrīmanyāyasudhāyāṃ prathamādhyāyasya caturthaḥ pādaḥ ||—|| prathamādhyāyas samāptaḥ ||—|| ❈
śrīkṛṣṇārpaṇam astu ||—|| ❈ || ❈ || ||

extent.measure: 193 numbered folios, 2 guard folios at the beginning of the bundle and 2 at the end

supportDesc.foliation: Nandināgarī numerals, on the left margin of the recto, 1 to 193.
supportDesc.condition: Good state of preservation, in spite of some bore holes produced by insects.

additions.desc: On the top left side of the recto of the first flyleaf, running over three lines, there is an indication about the text title, contents, and number of folios: nyāyasudhāśāstrayonitvādhikaraṇam ārabhya saṃpūrṇaprathamādhyāya graṃ 1 yiṣṭakke 193 vāni.
Title written on the outside of the wooden cover: śrīmanyāyasudhāprathamodhyāsaṃpūrṇa.

listBibl.bibl: Janert, Klaus Ludwig, Poti, N. Narasimhan. 1987. Verzeichnis der orientalischen Handschriften in Deutschland. Band II, 8. Stuttgart: F. Steiner. MS 3454. p. 1091.

encodingDesc.p: Spaces between words added where possible. ❈ denotes a puṣpikā.
